questionData.explanation_of_Question: This question tests your ability to convert an active sentence into its passive equivalent.
hints: Identify the subject and object in the original sentence.
The object of the active sentence becomes the subject of the passive sentence.
Use the correct form of 'to be' and the past participle of the main verb.
questionData.instruction: Rewrite the following sentence in the passive voice.
standard_answers: The mouse was chased by the cat.

questionData.explanation_of_Question: This question assesses your skill in combining two simple sentences into a single complex or compound sentence using an appropriate conjunction.
hints: Consider the relationship between the two sentences (cause/effect, reason, contrast, etc.).
Choose a conjunction that accurately reflects this relationship (e.g., so, because, but, although).
questionData.instruction: Combine the following two sentences into one using a suitable conjunction.
questionData.original_sentence: It was raining heavily. We stayed indoors.
standard_answers: It was raining heavily, so we stayed indoors.
We stayed indoors because it was raining heavily.

questionData.explanation_of_Question: This question requires you to rephrase the sentence to express the opposite meaning using the specific word 'never'.
hints: Find the word that expresses 'always' or a similar concept.
Replace the relevant part of the sentence to incorporate 'never' and convey the opposite meaning.
questionData.instruction: Rewrite the following sentence using the word "never".
questionData.original_sentence: He is always late for meetings.
standard_answers: He is never on time for meetings.
He is never early for meetings.

questionData.explanation_of_Question: This question tests your understanding of comparative and superlative forms of adjectives and how to convert between them.
hints: The original sentence makes a comparison stating that one building is taller than *all* others in a group.
This comparison implies that the building is the *most* tall.
Use the definite article 'the' before the superlative form.
questionData.instruction: Rewrite the following sentence using the superlative form of the adjective.
questionData.original_sentence: This building is taller than any other building in the city.
standard_answers: This is the tallest building in the city.
questionData.transformation_type: Change Degree of Comparison (Comparative to Superlative)

questionData.explanation_of_Question: This question assesses your ability to express a condition and its result using an 'if' clause.
hints: Identify the condition and the result in the original sentence.
The condition is usually introduced by 'if'.
For a likely future result based on a present condition, use the structure: If + simple present, ... will + base verb.
questionData.instruction: Rewrite the following sentence using an "if" clause.
questionData.original_sentence: You must study hard to pass the exam.
standard_answers: If you study hard, you will pass the exam.
